item.title: 2024-04-14 661c38e7036fe
item.description: ü§ñ My 4-year-old and I have been playing Cubetto lately, it's been a really nice way to teach coding without a screen. Having a physical robot move is a very tactile and satisfying debug cycle for my little one, he loves it! https://www.primotoys.com/
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

Check out ‚Ä¶

item.title: 2024-01-30 65b959bb77c61
item.description: ‚ú® My corne mechanical keyboard broke several months ago. The thought of desoldering a bunch of chips makes me very sad. Lesson learned to have a case that prevents the ports from wiggling. Apparently I don‚Äôt know better. ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

item.title: 2024-01-02 6593e77fba663
item.description:
üöÄ Launch Alert: Platform Engineering Monthly

Excited to share the first edition of my newsletter, covering the latest in platform engineering - from insightful articles to upcoming events and cool projects. Check it out and join the conversation! https://platformengineeringmonthly.substack.com/p/platform-engineering-monthly-december
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: 2023-12-26 658ae95aaac96
item.description: üë®‚Äçüíª I made Code Capsule a small little container dev environment I can hop onto so I don't pollute my OS. Has been useful while I'm doing personal projects on a work laptop. https://github.com/shano/code-capsule

item.title: 2023-12-24 65888b9139127
item.description: ‚ú® How it works is I share a note using my kindle scribe, the email is forwarded to Amazon SES which invokes a Lambda that extracts the text and updates my status using the API.

item.title: 2023-06-05 647d85200829e
item.description: üï∫ Nice! I'm getting one of the early dev beepberry devices. Currently working on a way to boot the OS up in qemu and measure the times. Hoping I can easily test boot flags and see if I can reduce. Any feedback welcome! https://github.com/beeper/beepberry/pull/5/files ‚Ä¶

item.title: 2023-04-07 64301828b7731
item.description: ‚ú® Engineers that depend on well defined public interfaces, I expect ChatGPT will make you very productive. I had some weird requirements around figuring out when resources in a AWS CFN Stack are relied upon outside the stack. ChatGPT made a great start!
item.dc:creator: Shane Dowling

item.title: 2023-04-02 6429582ab25dc
item.description: üòÆ Last night in bed on my phone, with ChatGPT and a Python IDE, I wrote a script that pulls down all the weeks events from my Caldav server, writes those events to a PDF and emails it to my kindle scribe via SMTP so I can do late night planning ‚Ä¶

item.title: 2023-02-02 63dc46c730ecd

item.title: 2023-02-01 63dace4d9cbd3
item.description: ‚å®Ô∏è The only way to get on with a programmable keyboard is to define your own layout. I swear my layout is the only logical way, which I assume is how everyone else feels. My mega short guide is here: https://shanedowling.com/knowledge-garden/#/page/crkbd
